• Relational Databases
  • Simple Query
  • Filter Results
  • Order Results
  • Aggregate Functions
  • Insert Values

Simple Query

SELECT * FROM [schema].[table]

  • Basic
  • Stuff

Filter Results

Filter results using the WHERE clause

SELECT * FROM [schema].[table] WHERE column1 = 1

  • Logial operators like AND and OR can be used
  • Using functions in the WHERE clause is allowed

Order Results

Use the ORDER BY clause to sort you results

SELECT * FROM [schema].[table] ORDER BY column1, column2 ASC

  • ASC orders ascending
  • DESC orders descending

Aggregate Functions

Calculates the sum of a column

SELECT SUM(column1) FROM [schema].[table] GROUP BY column2

  • GROUP by calculates sums for the values of column 2

Insert Values

To insert Data into a table use query like this:

INSER INTO [schema].[table] VALUES (1,2,'drei')

  • Order of value in parenthesis needs to macth order of columns in table
  • Be careful to use right datatypes
